name: character_species
description: Available species for character creation in Five Parsecs from Home

species.name: Human
species.description: Humans are the most common species in the galaxy, known for their adaptability and tenacity. They have spread to countless worlds and can be found in virtually every profession and social stratum.

special_abilities.name: Adaptable
special_abilities.description: Humans can reroll one failed check per battle.

special_abilities.name: Quick Learner
special_abilities.description: Humans gain +1 XP after each mission.

starting_equipment_options: Specialized equipment package (choose one skill and gain related gear)
homeworlds: Various colony worlds throughout the galaxy
species.culture_notes: Human cultures are incredibly diverse, reflecting their origins from Old Earth and subsequent adaptation to countless colony worlds. They tend to form the backbone of most interstellar governments and corporations.

species.name: Synthoid
species.description: Synthetic humanoids created for labor, warfare, or companionship who have gained independence. They possess artificial bodies with organic components and fully sentient AI minds.

special_abilities.name: Artificial Body
special_abilities.description: Synthoids are immune to poison, disease, and do not need to breathe. They recover from injuries faster, healing one additional wound during recovery.

special_abilities.name: Machine Logic
special_abilities.description: Synthoids gain +1 on all Tech skill checks.

species.culture_notes: Synthoid culture is still developing, with many seeking to define their identity beyond their original programming. Some embrace their artificial nature, while others attempt to become more 'human-like'. Many face prejudice and legal restrictions in certain jurisdictions.

species.name: Altered Human
species.description: Humans who have been genetically modified or cybernetically enhanced beyond standard medical procedures, often for specific environments or purposes.

special_abilities.name: Enhanced Physiology
special_abilities.description: Altered Humans can select one physical attribute (strength, reflexes, endurance) at character creation and gain +1 to all related checks.

special_abilities.name: Specialized Adaptation
special_abilities.description: Altered Humans have been modified for specific environments or tasks. Choose one environment type (aquatic, low-gravity, high-radiation, etc.) or task (combat, technical work, stealth) and gain immunity to related hazards or +1 to related checks.

starting_equipment_options: Specialized equipment related to their modifications
species.culture_notes: Altered Humans often face discrimination from baseline humans, with some viewing their modifications as 'unnatural'. They frequently form tight-knit communities with others who share similar modifications. Some alterations are obvious, while others are invisible to casual observation.

species.name: Avian
species.description: Humanoid species with avian characteristics including feathers, lightweight bones, and in some cases, vestigial wings. Known for their keen eyesight and agility.

special_abilities.name: Keen Senses
special_abilities.description: Avians gain +2 on all awareness checks and cannot be surprised.

special_abilities.name: Gliding
special_abilities.description: Avians can safely descend from any height and can glide horizontally a distance equal to the height they fell.

species.culture_notes: Avian cultures typically value freedom of movement and open spaces. Their architecture favors height and openness, with many structures featuring multiple levels connected by open air rather than stairs. Many Avians find enclosed spaces psychologically distressing.

species.name: Reptilian
species.description: Humanoid species with reptilian features such as scales, cold-blooded physiology, and regenerative capabilities. Known for their durability and patience.

special_abilities.name: Natural Armor
special_abilities.description: Reptilians have tough scales that provide a natural armor save of 6+.

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.description: Reptilians can regenerate wounds more quickly, healing one additional wound during recovery.

species.culture_notes: Reptilian cultures tend to be tradition-bound and hierarchical, with great respect for elders. They often have complex social rituals and can appear stoic or emotionless to other species. Many Reptilian societies practice sun-worship or similar heat-based religious practices.

species.name: Insectoid
species.description: Humanoid species with insect-like characteristics including exoskeletons, compound eyes, and sometimes multiple limbs. Known for their specialized abilities and collective mindset.

special_abilities.name: Exoskeleton
special_abilities.description: Insectoids have a natural armor save of 5+ but cannot wear standard armor (must be custom-fitted at increased cost).

special_abilities.name: Wall Climbing
special_abilities.description: Insectoids can climb walls and ceilings at their normal movement rate.

starting_equipment_options: Specialized tools adapted for insectoid physiology
species.culture_notes: Insectoid cultures often emphasize collective effort over individual achievement. Many insectoid societies are organized around specialized roles or castes, though those who venture into the wider galaxy are typically more individualistic than their homeworld kin. They often have difficulty understanding the concept of personal space.

species.name: Psyker
species.description: Humanoids with powerful psychic abilities, often appearing similar to baseline humans but with distinctive features like unusual eye colors or faint bioluminescence.

special_abilities.name: Psychic Powers
special_abilities.description: Psykers begin with two psionic powers of their choice and can use them a number of times per battle equal to their Savvy stat.

special_abilities.name: Mental Shield
special_abilities.description: Psykers are immune to mind control and gain +2 to resist other psychic abilities.

starting_equipment_options: Psionic focus items (crystals, meditation aids, etc.)
homeworlds: Ancient colony worlds with mysterious histories
species.culture_notes: Psyker cultures often revolve around the development and control of their abilities. Many face fear and persecution from non-psychic populations, leading to secretive communities or nomadic lifestyles. Some worlds revere psykers as spiritual leaders, while others hunt them as dangerous aberrations.

species.name: Felinoid
species.description: Humanoid species with feline characteristics including fur, enhanced reflexes, and acute senses. Known for their agility and independence.

special_abilities.name: Night Vision
special_abilities.description: Felinoids ignore penalties for darkness and low-light conditions.

special_abilities.name: Lightning Reflexes
special_abilities.description: Felinoids always act first in the first turn of battle unless facing another Felinoid.

species.culture_notes: Felinoid cultures typically value personal freedom and individual prowess. Their societies tend to be loosely organized, with leadership based on demonstrated ability rather than heredity. Many Felinoids have a strong territorial instinct and can be fiercely protective of their personal space and possessions.
